story:
Once upon a time, in a lush and vibrant town in Brazil, there was a kind-hearted father named Joaquim. Joaquim had a beautiful little girl named Isabela, who was known for her curious spirit and her love for all living creatures.

One day, while Isabela was playing in the garden, she discovered a tiny, injured bird with feathers as colorful as a rainbow. Isabela's heart ached for the little bird, and she decided to take it in and nurse it back to health.

She made a small nest from soft cloth and placed it in a shoebox, feeding the bird a diet of mashed fruit and water. As the days went by, the bird began to heal and its spirit lifted. Isabela was overjoyed to see her new friend growing stronger and more lively each day.

As the bird's wings healed, Isabela decided it was time for the bird to return to the wild. But first, she wanted to give it a proper send-off. So, she and her father Joaquim planned a celebration for the bird, inviting all of their friends and neighbors to join them in the town square.

The day of the celebration arrived, and the town square was filled with music and laughter as people gathered to wish the bird a fond farewell. Isabela stood before the crowd, a mix of excitement and sadness in her heart, as she held the bird gently in her hands.

"My friends," she began, "Today we say goodbye to our dear friend, the rainbow bird, who has touched all of our hearts with its beauty and spirit. Though we will miss it dearly, we know that it is time for it to return to the skies and soar among the clouds once more."

With that, Isabela opened her hands and the rainbow bird took flight, soaring high above the crowd. The people cheered and clapped as they watched the bird perform a breathtaking aerial dance. And as the bird disappeared into the horizon, Isabela knew that it would always hold a special place in her heart.

That night, as Isabela lay in bed, she closed her eyes and dreamed of the rainbow bird soaring high above the clouds, free and wild. And she knew that even though the bird was gone, the memories of their time together would live on, forever reminding her of the beauty and wonders of life.

And with that, Isabela drifted off to sleep, her heart full of love and gratitude for the magical adventure she had shared with the rainbow bird.

The end.

Note: I hope you and your child enjoyed the story, I am glad to help and make this bedtime story for your child. Let me know if there's anything else I can assist you with. Good night!
